required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Nasoalveolar Molding Techniques in Complete Unilateral Cleft Lip Patient
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Two Nasoalveolar Molding Techniques in Complete Unilateral Cleft Lip Patient

brief_summary.textblock: Two types of Presurgical Nasoalveolar Molding (NAM) coexist in Craniofacial Center in Chang Gung Memorial Hospital. The objective of this study is to compare the number of clinical visits, total prices, complications and nasal symmetry between these two NAM reconstruction methods.

detailed_description.textblock:
Grayson's NAM reconstruction starts with alveolar molding first. The alveolar molding is made by gradual modification of the acrylic plate with periodic acrylic add on and grinding. After the alveolar cleft gap is less than 5 mm (usually at the end of second months), nasal molding was added to the alveolar molding plate.
Figueroa's NAM reconstruction use labial tapes and acrylic relief to the palatal plate to approximate alveolar gap. The device starts with nasal and alveolar molding simultaneously.

primary_outcome.description: Nostril height: the vertical distance between horizontal reference lines to the highest point of nostril aperture.

primary_outcome.time_frame: (T2) after nasoalveolar molding (participants' nasoalveolar molding will be finished before surgery, an expected average of 3-months old)
primary_outcome.description: Nostril height: the vertical distance between horizontal reference lines to the highest point of nostril aperture.
Nostril height: the vertical distance between horizontal reference lines to the highest point of nostril aperture.
Nostril height: the vertical distance between horizontal reference lines to the highest point of nostril aperture.
Nostril width: The widest horizontal distance between the inner medial and lateral border of nostril aperture.

primary_outcome.time_frame: (T2) after nasoalveolar molding (participants' nasoalveolar molding will be finished before surgery, an expected average of 3-months old)
primary_outcome.description: Nostril width: The widest horizontal distance between the inner medial and lateral border of nostril aperture.
Nostril width: The widest horizontal distance between the inner medial and lateral border of nostril aperture.
Nostril width: The widest horizontal distance between the inner medial and lateral border of nostril aperture.

primary_outcome.measure: The nasal morphology - Nasal sill height 3
primary_outcome.description: Nasal sill height: the vertical distance between the horizontal reference line to the lowest border of nostril aperture.

primary_outcome.measure: The nasal morphology - Nasal sill height 4
primary_outcome.description: Nasal sill height: the vertical distance between the horizontal reference line to the lowest border of nostril aperture.
Nostril area: the area presented by nostril aperture.

primary_outcome.time_frame: (T2) after nasoalveolar molding (participants' nasoalveolar molding will be finished before surgery, an expected average of 3-months old)
primary_outcome.description: Nostril area: the area presented by nostril aperture.
Nostril area: the area presented by nostril aperture.
Nostril area: the area presented by nostril aperture.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initial of nasoalveolar molding to finish of nasoalveolar molding (participants' nasoalveolar molding will be finished before surgery, an expected average of 3-months old)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of NAM = Operation date - NAM initiation date

secondary_outcome.measure: total number of visits before surgical correction
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the initial visit to the date of surgery (participants' surgery will be performed on 3-month of age)
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of orthodontic visit or NAM adjustment = number of adjustment of NAM

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initial orthodontic visit to finish of NAM (participants' nasoalveolar molding will be finished before surgery, an expected average of 3-months old)
secondary_outcome.description: Cost = cost of each visit of orthodontic and adjustment of NAM before surgery

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From initial of NAM to finish of NAM (participants' nasoalveolar molding will be finished before surgery, an expected average of 3-months old)
secondary_outcome.description: Any complication like mucosa ulceration and facial skin irritation

arm_group.description: Intervention: Grayson nasoalveolar molding This technique uses an acrylic plate to mold the alveolar segments and uses an extension to mold the alar cartilage of the nasal component. The construction is made by gradual modification of the acrylic plate with periodic acrylic add on and grinding. When the alveolar gap is reduced to 5 mm, nasal component are added to gradually mold the nasal cartilage and other nasal structures.

Intervention: Figueroa's nasoalveolar molding Figueroa technique uses labial tapes and acrylic relief to the palatal plate to approximate alveolar gap [3]. The nasal component is added in the beginning of the treatment to mold the nasal cartilage.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Complete unilateral cleft lip infant
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Incomplete unilateral cleft lip infant
- Association of other craniofacial anomalies

clinical_study.keyword: Unilateral complete cleft lip, Nasoalveolar molding
